title: Manchester restaurants where kids eat FREE this February half term 2017
text:
What's On Manchester restaurants where kids eat FREE this February half term 2017 It's not cheap to eat out with the kids but these places have made it a little bit easier Share Get Manchester United FC updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Eating out is expensive at the best of times, let alone when you're paying for a host of other activities over half term. 
Thankfully there are some places trying to give the parents a bit of help over the school break by letting the kids eat for FREE. 
While some offer a free children's main for every adult meal, others are giving little ones the whole shebang - with a drink and dessert thrown in. 
With some schools off from February 13 to 17 and the majority off the following week, dates of offers vary so please check before booking. Bella Italia 
Children can get a free three-course Piccolo or Grande meal with the purchase of every adult main meal at Bella Italia restaurants. 
The Piccolo mains are aimed at children aged two to six years, with the Grande for seven to 11-year-olds. 
Dishes range from pizza and pasta options to burgers, chicken strips and pizza dogs - hot dogs with mozzarella and tomato sauce baked in pizza dough. 
The kids eat free offer runs from February 10 to March 31 and the menu now features a limited edition Wimpy Kid Gelato sundae after Bella teamed up with the publisher to celebrate the paperback launch of Diary of a Wimpy Kid: Old School. 
You must sign up to the Bella Italia Club here to redeem the offer. 
The award-winning menu also includes drinks with free refills on squash giving families even better value for money. 
This includes both still or fizzy water, a wide range of flavours and rather funky straws which the kids get to take home. 
For the babies on board the restaurants serve Ella's Kitchen pouches for £1.50, with carrots, apples and parsnips for stage one and chicken casserole for stage two. 
Desserts to choose from include cookie dough cake with ice cream and choccie brownies. 
To find your nearest Bella Italia, including restaurants at Salford Quays and Manchester Arndale, visit the website here . Jamie's Italian 
Jamie Oliver is continuing with the offer he first launched last summer and letting kids eat for free at his Jamie's Italian in King Street. 
From February 11 to 26, for every main course you order, one of your children can enjoy a meal on them. 
Young diners can choose between six dishes and also enjoy a 'shake me' salad, drink and dessert on the house. 
Children must be 12 or under and be accompanied by an adult, purchasing a main meal. 
Jamie's Italian, 100 King St, Manchester, M2 4WU. Cafe Football 
Cafe Football Old Trafford is celebrating half term by offering free meals for children aged six and under. 
From February 17 to the 26 February, children can choose from any of the meals on Cafe Football’s kids menu including the tasty CF burger and its spaghetti and meatballs with tomato sauce topped with cheese. 
Children under six are entitled to one free kid’s meal per every paying adult. 
Cafe Football, Sir Matt Busby Way, Stretford, Manchester, M17 1WS. Cabana 
Cabana in Manchester's Corn Exchange is offering a kids eat free deal all day, every day from February 11 to 19. 
Kids can enjoy three courses and a drink from the kids menu, which includes burgers, breaded chicken breast in a bun and a mozzarella torrado (a toastie to you and me). Cabana (Photo: Phil Tragen) 
The venue focuses on Rio street food so side dishes include rice, French fries and corn on the cob. 
Dessert is either apple slices with honey dip, vanilla or chocolate ice cream, or mango sorbet. 
One free kids meal per individual full paying adult. Not available with any other offer. 
Cabana, The Corn Exchange, Exchange Square, Manchester, M4 3TR. Pier Eight Restaurant and Bar, The Lowry 
The kids eat free offer runs at The Lowry's Pier Eight Restaurant when any family performance is on. 
For every adult that dines the venue is offering a free children's meal. And it will match each course like for like, so if you get pudding, they'll get one too. What more reason do you need to devour a dessert? 
The kids menu includes starters of garlic bread, soup, or salad and mains of sausages and mash, tomato pasta and fish fingers and chips. 
For dessert they can choose from yoghurt and apple slices, jam sponge and custard or ice cream. 
Lowry-themed colouring and activity sheets are on hand to keep the little people busy while you wait. 
The offer, which doesn't include sides and drinks, is on throughout half term and whenever there is a children’s performance. 
Pier Eight, Salford Quays, M50 3AZ. Las Iguanas 
Kids eat free with a child's meal for every adult meal ordered from the a la carte menu between February 18 and 26. 
Children can pick from the varied 'Ninos menu' - which features everything from burgers and crispy chicken to 'wacky tacos' and 'crazy quesadillas'. 
Kids desserts include jelly, fruit, ice lollies, ice cream, chocolate brownie and ice, and churros. 
Drinks are again included in the deal with a 'bottomless squash' option of blackcurrant or orange. 
And if you've got a tiddler with you, then there is FREE organic baby food and restaurant staff will happily warm bottles for you too. 
Las Iguanas, The Great Hall, Trafford Centre, M17 8AA and 84 Deansgate, Manchester, M3 2ER. 
If you know of a place where kids eat free over half term, please send the details to emma.gill@trinitymirror.com.
